file_content.text: Rogun the Butcher's bounty hunters are on their way right now. We don't want to be here when they arrive.
Skavak took your ship and the guns to Coruscant. If you go now, he won't know you're coming for him.
How do I get all the way to Coruscant without a ship?
Getting there might be rough.
You don't need your own starship to leave Ord Mantell--not anymore.
What kind of scam is Skavak pulling on Coruscant?
What's he up to?
He wouldn't tell me. It's something big, though.
I still have plenty of time to kill you before I go.
That won't save you.
Every second you waste threatening me lets Rogun's bounty hunters get closer. Am I really worth it?
The separatists are retreating from this island thanks to you, and the Republic just reopened the shuttle port.
I'll give you a shuttle pass to Coruscant if you let me disappear. Do we have a deal?
I guess we do.
Good. Then I'll be on my way.
I'd say it's been a pleasure, but I hate to lie.
Good riddance.
I hope you stay out of trouble after this.
Straighten out your life.
Just get lost, you cheap tramp.
Leave, already.
When you find Skavak, go easy on him. He's a two-timing liar, but... it would be nice to see him again, someday.
I want more.
Naturally. I always keep some money handy for moments like this. Take all of it.
Don't mind if I do.
Smart move.
I'm glad we could be reasonable about things. Here's that shuttle pass, too.
When you find Skavak, tell him... tell him I had no choice, all right? Goodbye, Captain.
Glad that ended peacefully. I'm not one to hurt women.
You don't seem to have trouble hurting anyone else. Why women?
You're kidding, right?
I was raised to tip my hat and open doors for ladies, not blast them.
You probably think I'm some dumb farm boy, huh? Head full of old-fashioned ideas?
You have a lot to learn about women, Corso.
The jury is still out.
No doubt about that. Sorry if I overstepped myself, Captain.
I don't think you're dumb. You're actually kind of sweet.
You're so cute.
Oh. Well... thanks, Captain. I like you, too.
Good guess.
I can't help how I was raised--and I don't apologize for it, either.
No good would've come of it.
Me neither.
I'm not letting her off for killing Viidu. I'll spread the word about what she did.
You don't care that she killed your boss?
What about Viidu?
'Course I do--which is why I'm gonna make sure people know what she did to him.
Not really interested in your feelings 'bout this, Corso.
Who cares what you think?
All I'm saying is, letting Syreena go was for the best. We've got enough troubles as it is.
Poor old Viidu. I wish he could hear what we did--would've put a smile on his face.
Think we made any difference in this war?
I'd like to believe it.
We killed a hundred separatists between the two of us. They'll think twice before sending reinforcements.
Wish we had time for a proper funeral, but we need to move.
Sorry he's dead.
If Viidu was alive, he'd agree.
I want to go kill more separatists.
Let's keep fighting.
It's not healthy for us to stick around, Captain. I believed what Syreena said about bounty hunters coming.
We don't know how long Skavak will stay on Coruscant, either. Let's hop a shuttle and catch him while we can.
You're planning to tag along?
"We"?
I'm not bailing out on you now, Captain. Besides, my Torchy still needs rescuing.
Good idea.
I'm never coming back to this lousy planet.
Great--I'm sick of this place.
Viidu left me some stuff. I expect he'd want me to share it with you.
Let's head for the shuttle port. We'll be off this planet before you know it.
Thanks for the money, but I'm killing you anyway.
Still not enough. [Kill her]
You double-crossing scum!
I'll take that shuttle pass off your corpse.
No need. [Kill her]
You ladies sure can be vicious. Hope you don't ever expect me to shoot a woman.
That bothered you?
Why not?
If a woman was shooting at you, you wouldn't shoot back?
Even if you had to?
Self-defense is one thing. You backed Syreena into a corner.
What are you, some kind of coward?
Don't be such a baby.
'Course not--but I was raised to be respectful to ladies. Even the bad ones.
That was cold-blooded, Captain. Where I come from, real men don't shoot ladies.
She brought that on herself when she killed Viidu.
It was justice.
I appreciate the sentiment, but I was raised to treat women differently.
I didn't want her warning Skavak about us.
She knew too much.
I see the percentage in that--but killing her was a poor way to keep her quiet.
Where I come from, we kill anybody we want--got it?
Watch your mouth.
All I'm saying is, executing women is hard on my conscience.
You have no idea what I'm capable of, Captain. You've just signed your own death mark!
I can't believe you fried Viidu, sweetheart. So what if he caught you talking to separatists?
He threatened to turn me in to Rogun the Butcher. I had to kill him. Besides, now we can finally be together.
Yeah... and the thing is, my cargo hold is full and I'm busy with work. I'll call you some time, though. I promise.
What are you talking about? You promised to get me out of here. I've done everything for you, Skavak!
You did it for the money, same as me. The only difference is you're not actually gettin' paid. I'll see you around, darling.
Captain? I... I didn't see you come in. It's wonderful you're still alive. How long have you been back?
I heard everything, Syreena.
Long enough.
Then there's no point in lying to you.
Your friends in the secret base ratted you out.
The separatists say hello.
I should've known those half-wits wouldn't kill you. No use pretending, then.
You're so dead.
I guess you heard all that, huh? Look, I know things that can help you.
Skavak used me just like he did everyone else--that man could charm the armor off a Mandalorian.
I never had anything personal against you, Captain. If I promise to help you, will you let me go?
You think you deserve to get away after what you did?
Why should I?
You killed Viidu, Syreena. We're not taking that lightly.
It was self-defense. Viidu was going to turn me over to Rogun. Guess what "the Butcher" does to his enemies?
Skavak is the one who set all this up. If you want to punish someone, he's the one who deserves it.
We'll see, won't we?
We don't have time to negotiate.
Scum like you give the rest of us girls a bad name.
You deserve much worse.
I'm no different from you. We all do what we have to.
Don't expect to sweet-talk your way out of this.
Not likely.
Much as I might enjoy the challenge of cracking that hard shell of yours, we're a little pressed for time.
What more do we have to say to each other? Goodbye, Captain.
Please come back alive, Captain. Viidu and I are both counting on you.
Sorry, I don't handle unstable chemicals. That's Viidu's department.
Thank you for stepping in, Captain. I was so frightened.
I couldn't let those thugs push you around.
Not a problem.
Sometimes I feel like I'm all alone here. It's good to know that's not the case.
I've never had anyone defend me before. I wish there were more men like you in this galaxy.
Luckily, those boys were pretty gullible.
I'm just glad they bought it.
Bluff? It's closer to the truth than I want to admit.
Next time, save yourself.
Sorry to put you in that position. I usually take care of myself.
You... you killed them all--for me. Thank you, Captain. I don't know what else to say.
Don't make a big deal out if it. I hardly broke a sweat.
"Thank you" will do fine.
They never stood a chance against you. Does anyone?
You'll be fine.
Having a friend like you means a lot to me.
If there's any way I can repay you, I will.
I didn't kill them for you. I just wanted a good fight.
Don't flatter yourself.
Regardless, I owe you my life. Those vile men were going to hurt me.
What Bracco said was true--Rogun the Butcher will kill Viidu if those blasters don't turn up.
I hope whatever course of action you're pursuing pays off, Captain. More lives than your own depend on it.
Everything will be alright. Trust me.
Then I won't let you down.
Hearing you say it makes me believe it.
Well, don't look at me.
Very well. I'm glad to know where we stand.
Why should I care if you live or die?
So?
Why would you help and then say that? I thought we were friends.
I'll be sure to keep out of harm's way from now on.
Viidu can't protect me anymore. He's not half the man you are.
Chin up, Syreena. As long as I'm around, you'll be safe.
Then again, who is?
You really mean that, don't you? You're so strong, so confident. I....
What can I say? Human men lack my special qualities.
[Flirt] I'm more than a man.
I wish I'd met you before Viidu. Maybe then....
Let's find a nice quiet spot to talk about that.
[Flirt] So why stay with him?
I... I can't do that to Viidu right now. Maybe when the danger is past....
This was a one-time deal.
But you've already done so much. I know somewhere deep down you care about me.
I should go. Viidu's waiting for you. I won't forget your kindness, Captain. Farewell, for now.
What are you looking at, you useless worm?
You've got some fire in you, lady.
The real Syreena.
Oh, you have no idea. Keep your distance unless you want to get burned.
If you had that blaster all along, why ask for my help?
You were armed?
Because I like to know who my friends are.
Maybe I just wanted to see what kind of man you are. Now I know.
Insult me again and you'll be sorry.
Watch your mouth.
What makes you think I'll waste another breath on you?
Goodbye, Captain. Thanks for nothing.
Leave me alone, Bracco. If Viidu knew about this, he'd--
Viidu? That blob can't even protect himself. It's only a matter of time before Rogun the Butcher punches your fat meal ticket for good.
You'd better start thinking about the future, girl. When Viidu's gone, you'll need new friends.
Captain, thank goodness. I could use your help here.
Throttle down, boys. Word is, Rogun the Butcher has his eye on Syreena.
Let's bluff them.
Th--that's right, Bracco. You don't want to get on Rogun's bad side.
He's already scoping out his future trophies, huh? Figures. It just proves Viidu ain't long for this world.
Let's go, guys.
There's nothing wrong with you scum a good thrashing won't fix.
Who wants the first beat-down?
We don't take beatings from aliens--we give them.
You're cute, little girl, but not so cute we won't make an example out of you.
You just picked a fight with the wrong bunch of guys, pal.
Any last words? Nevermind--we don't care!
I could really use credits.
You only look out for your own species? Good to know.
You're one cold-hearted woman, aren't you?
And here I thought you were a real man.
See this blaster up my sleeve, Bracco? Unless you want a scorch mark where your face used to be, get lost!
Hey, hey, take--take it easy! We don't want any trouble. See? We're--we're gonna....
You shouldn't keep Viidu waiting. He's in his office with Corso.
You must be the freighter captain Viidu's expecting. It's a pleasure to meet you in person. I'm Syreena.
Hello.
Likewise. My father flew tramp freighters, but I never developed a taste for space travel, myself. Too dangerous for me.
I have to say, you're a cut above the types we usually get in here. I'd almost forgotten what a real man looks like.
You seem a little out of place in this boy's club.
What's your job here?
Viidu has a taste for life's finer things, and he's decided I'm one of them.
What's a knockout like you doing in this dump?
[Flirt] Hi there.
I'm here to enhance the aesthetics of Viidu's surroundings. He enjoys looking at pretty things while he works.
I'm busy, lady. Get lost.
Beat it.
Don't be like that. Ord Mantell is a harsh place. We girls should stick together.
Don't be so mean. It never hurts to have friends, and I'm a good friend to have.
I heard about what happened with Skavak. Can't say I'm surprised. I told Viidu not to trust that scoundrel.
Viidu's putting on a brave face for me, but I can tell he's terrified. Is it bad? Should I be worried?
Actually, things are looking up.
Not a bit.
That's good to hear. I hope you'll let me know if that changes.
In situations like this, always trust your gut.
Follow your instincts.
Good advice. Thank you, Captain.
Leave everything to me, sweetheart.
[Flirt] I'll protect you.
It's comforting to know a confident man like you is taking care of things. I feel safer already.
Mind your own business.
If something bad is about to happen, I'd like to be as far from it as possible. A little warning is all I ask.
Sorry for keeping you from your appointment. Viidu's waiting in his office. I know he's eager to speak with you.
We've got important business.
I should go.
I'm sure you do. Thank you for indulging me.
I've wasted enough time on you.
Then stop talking.
I'll try to stay out of your way from now on.
I suppose I shouldn't keep you any longer. Viidu might get the wrong idea about us.
See you later.
If he's gonna suspect anyway....
[Flirt] Or the right idea.
Haha. I can see you're going to be trouble. We'll have to continue this discussion later.
Stay away, lady. You're the kind of trouble I don't need.
You don't interest me.
As you wish.
Farewell, Captain.
Welcome. My name is Syreena. If there's anything I can do for you, just ask.
